headline: Activist Elliott Builds Big Stake in Norwegian Cruise Line
summary: Activist Elliott Investment Management has built a more than 10% stake in  Norwegian Cruise Line  and plans to push for changes to turn the struggling cruise-ship operator around, according to people familiar with the matter.  Elliott, now one of Norwegian’s top investors, is planning to engage with the company to try to help fix its underperformance, the people said.  Its brands include the more premium Oceania Cruises and the luxury Regent Seven Seas Cruises.

content.title: Activist Elliott Builds Big Stake in Norwegian Cruise Line
content.summary: Activist Elliott Investment Management has built a more than 10% stake in  Norwegian Cruise Line  and plans to push for changes to turn the struggling cruise-ship operator around, according to people familiar with the matter. Its brands include the more premium Oceania Cruises and the luxury Regent Seven Seas Cruises.

headline: Billionaire Activist Elliott Just Put Norwegian Cruise Line in Its Crosshairs

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line Stock Jumps. Activist Elliott Takes Stake, Pushes for Big Change.
summary: Norwegian Cruise Line  shares rallied on Tuesday after activist Elliott Investment Management said it had taken a stake of more than 10% in the cruise line operator.  Elliott said in a press release that it had sent a letter to Norwegian’s board outlining the company’s “strategic and execution missteps during a time of strong demand in the cruise industry.”  The activist investor said it believes Norwegian is significantly undervalued despite being a “fundamentally strong business with substantial untapped potential.”

content.title: Norwegian Cruise Line Stock Jumps. Activist Elliott Takes Stake, Pushes for Big Change.
content.summary: Norwegian Cruise Line  shares rallied on Tuesday after activist Elliott Investment Management said it had taken a stake of more than 10% in the cruise line operator.  Elliott said in a press release that it had sent a letter to Norwegian’s board outlining the company’s “strategic and execution missteps during a time of strong demand in the cruise industry.”  The activist investor said it believes Norwegian is significantly undervalued despite being a “fundamentally strong business with substantial untapped potential.”

headline: Is Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings (NCLH) Pricing Reflect The Ongoing Cruise Sector Recovery
summary: If you are wondering whether Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings is attractively priced or already expensive, you are not alone. This article will walk you through what the current share price might be implying about its value. The stock recently closed at US$21.49, with returns of an 8.8% decline over 7 days, a 2.4% decline over 30 days, a 5.7% decline year to date and a 21.0% decline over the past year. The 3 year return sits at 26.6% and the 5 year return at a 24.9% decline. Recent headlines...
